Wait..... Since when does electrical current flow in the opposite direction of the electrons??

It's called "conventional" current flow, from the positive terminal to the negative terminal (which is opposite of electron flow).  This was before electrons were discovered so it just stuck out of habit and this is how circuits are still taught today.
